posts.name: Pranav Gupta
posts.cooked:
Every once and awhile when we try to deploy/build code we get this issue. We try to restart the computer, restart vscode, and close JDK binaries on task manager. All of these issues usually solve this issue but after a day or two it comes back again.

image 4032×3024 3.77 MB

image 4032×3024 3.77 MB

image 4032×3024 3.77 MB

posts.name: Noah Andrews
posts.cooked: The “Deprecated Gradle features” message is just a warning. Earlier in the log it says that the “build failed due to a Compile Error”. This indicates that there was a problem with your code. If you scroll up in the build log, you should find a more specific error message.

posts.name: Pranav Gupta
posts.cooked: It doesn’t let us scroll up to show more information about the error. The weird thing is this issue goes away by restarting the computer or doing the other things mentioned.

posts.name: Jeremy Reed
posts.cooked: Try looking at the problem tab and seeing if there’s anything that has a red symbol next to it. Those should also be any compile issues its running into. anything with the yellow symbol is just a warning.

posts.name: Pranav Gupta
posts.cooked: We did that and there are no red problems, just yellow warnings.

posts.name: Jeremy Reed
posts.cooked:
Do you get an error if you just run the WPI build task or is it only on deploying?

Also do you have your code in a repo that someone can take a look at to see if they are seeing the same error?

posts.name: Pranav Gupta
posts.cooked:
It’s on both.

Our github is:

Contribute to LangleyRobotics/RagnarRobot2023 development by creating an account on GitHub.

posts.name: Jeremy Reed
posts.cooked: Is the github just the java files? It appears to be missing the other surrounding files for building and deploying the code. How did you create your project initially?

posts.name: Pranav Gupta
posts.cooked: We just have the java files there but we’re moving over the rest of the stuff right now. The issue fixed itself with us just pulling our java code from github (the one we just pushed with errors) and re-running.

posts.name: Sam Carlberg
posts.cooked:
What went wrong: Execution failed for task :compileJava.

Changes are not tracked, unable determine incremental changes.

This error crops up when the code project is stored in a OneDrive folder on your computer. OneDrive removes files from your computer and stores them in Microsoft’s cloud, which breaks the gradle build system.

2024 WPILib projects will be prevented from building in a OneDrive folder. There’s nothing we can do to stop people from cloning project repos into OneDrive folders, but you’ ll see an error message if you run anything

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
